text:
<The Art of Suspicion>

<dimly lit room, tense atmosphere>
<watchful eyes, lurking tension>
Speaker 1: "If I shut him up too soon…"

Speaker 2: "You’re laughing, you don’t believe me again?"

Speaker 1: "Every case becomes a special case…"

---

<darkened alley, shadowy figure>
<anxiety hangs in the air>
Speaker 1: "Let him know I’m watching…"

Speaker 2: "He’ll lose his head eventually!" 

Speaker 1: "It’s delightful, isn’t it?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The speaker argues that allowing a suspected criminal to remain in suspense can lead to revealing evidence, as the psychological pressure may drive them to act in ways that confirm their guilt.
